definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: bear tidings (√ rub smooth the face; cf. Ar. ba4ara remove the face of surface of a thing, cf. Ar. ba4ira be glad, joyful; ba4orah;u bimawluwdin he rejoiced him with the message of the birth of a son; Eth. basara: bring a joyful message, so AS. bussuru (Pa.) Dl:Pr 170, Sab. [[תבשר]] DHM:MV, also [[בשר]] n.pr.dei,ba4iyrun DHM:ZMG 1883, 358, CIS:iv. 1, 41, 1. 3)—
gladden with good tidings: birth of a son Je 20:15; victory 1Sa 31:9, 2Sa 1:20, 1Ch 10:9, Ps 68:12; [[היה כמבשׂר בעיניו]] he was in his eyes as a bearer of good tidings 2Sa 4:10.
bear tidings 2Sa 18:19, 2Sa 18:20, 2Sa 18:20, 2Sa 18:26; even of evil 1Sa 4:l7, and so with acc. [[בשׂר טוב]] 1Ki 1:42.

herald as glad tidings: the salvation of God, peach (chiefly exilic usage) the advent of ´[[י]] in salvation Na 2:1, Is 40:9, Is 40:9, Is 41:27, Is 52:7, Is 52:7; the praises of Yahweh Is 60:6; His righteousness in the great congregation Ps 40:10; His salvation daily Ps 96:2 = 1Ch 16:23; the Messianic servant preaches good tidings to the meek Is 61:1.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. [[יִתְבַּשֵּׂר]] 2Sa 18:31 receive good tidings (so Kirkp. Klo; cf. Ar. ba4ira IV. X; otherwise AV).
